Top 11 Beautiful Lakes in Ladakh

India > Ladakh

Explore in Ladakh

Ladakh is a country of mountains, valleys, lush greenery, and beautiful lakes. The sight of the sparkling blue water reflecting the bright heavens and mountains is both awe-inspiring and tranquil. Leh has become famous for several reasons, one of which is to embark on an exhilarating journey over rocky terrain to see the beautiful glorified lake in Leh, which is so soul-satisfying. Ladakh is a natural wonder; the snow-capped mountains in the background, the spectacular view from the summit, and its tantalizing cuisine all combine to make it a must-see trip.

01. Tso Moriri Lake


Tso Moriri Lake, also known as Mountain Lake, is one of the prominent lakes in the Ladakh area of Jammu & Kashmir, India. Tso Moriri, a tranquil and beautiful high-altitude lake in Changthang Wildlife Sanctuary, is located at a magnificent 4595 metres above sea level. It extends for up to 28 kilometres and is on average 100 feet deep. The unique migrating birds flying over the gorgeous lake will make you fall in love with nature, while the reflection of snow-capped mountains in the pristine waters of the lake will calm your soul. The lake is surrounded by towering mountains, making it a hidden gem in the frozen nature of Ladakh. 


Traveller Information:

  • Famous for: Saline Lake, Endangered Species, Highest high-altitude lake.
  • Best Time to Visit: April- September
  • Duration: 2-3 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Camping, Hiking
  • Other Places to visit: Tsokar Lake, Sarchu, Nimu.

02. Pangong Tso Lake


Pangong lake, commonly known as Pangong Tso, sits serenely at 14,270 feet above sea level. Surprisingly, the lake is 12 kilometres long and is between India and China. The unreal blue waters are brackish or salty, and this attribute prevents any aquatic life from surviving in them. Furthermore, with temperatures ranging from -30 to -10 degrees, even this salty lake freezes over in massive ice sheets, which is the polar opposite of salt-laden water bodies. Pangong has another interesting feature: it can change colours like a chameleon, from blue to green to even grey.


Traveller Information:

  • Famous for: Highest Brackish Water lake, Salt-Water Lake, Changing Colour.
  • Best Time to Visit: April- September
  • Duration: 2-3 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Camping, Hiking.
  • Other Places to visit: Khardung La Pass, Spangmik Village.

03. Yarab Tso


Yarab Tso is located near the Nubra Region's Panamik town and is a must-see for anybody traveling the valley. Yarab Tso encapsulates the tranquility and calm of Nubra Valley and disperses its aroma over the valley. Surrounded by sheer cliffs and towering mountain peaks, this lake is one of the highest in Ladakh and its beauty is hard to match. Yarab Tso is more than just a lake; it has many important Hindu stories of Leh attached to it, making it a sacred lake in the area.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Hidden Lake, Holy Lake
  • Best Time to Visit: February- October
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs 


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Trekking, Camping
  • Other Places to visit: Panamik Village, Diskit Monastery

04. Lang Tso and Stat Tso


The twin lakes of Stat Tso and Lang Tso in Ladakh make for a beautiful visit. The lakes are located in Ladakh's Zanskar area, near the Pensi la pass, and are explored in conjunction with the pass. They are little lakes close together and, thus their relative lack of appeal, remain one of Ladakh's lesser-known locations. Exploring Stat Tso and Lang Tso will let you create unique experiences in Ladakh because it is a destination that few people are aware of, making it a must-see stop on their Manali to Leh bike trip.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Twin Lake, Sightseeing
  • Best Time to Visit: May-August
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Bike ride, Camping.
  • Other Places to visit: Tso Kar Lake, Hunder Sand Dunes, and Kargil War Memorial.

05. Kiagar Tso


Kiagar Tso is a breathtakingly beautiful place en route to Tso Moriri Lake. It is surrounded by nomadic tribes of the Changthang plateau in the Leh region. This lake, which is about 4000 metres above sea level, offers travellers a well-deserved respite in the shape of a tranquil environment of dazzling blue waters surrounded by towering mountains on all sides. The Chang pass is also visible near the lake, which adds to its beauty and makes it look unique and fascinating in its own right. 


Traveller Information:

  • Famous for: Nomadic Ladakhis, Flora and Fauna
  • Best Time to Visit: April- September
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Trekking, Camping
  • Other Places to visit: Pangong Tso Lake, Charag Tso.

06. Nyak Tso


Nyak Tso is a small, calm lake in Ladakh, the Himalayas. It is located in Tibet, 30 kilometres from Rudog in Ladakh, and is not part of the Indian border. Although, due to divisional boundaries, getting to the location is a little difficult task. This lake, nestled in the centre of a tremendous mountain and cliff, offers a spectacular view that is well worth your time and money, as well as an experience to remember for years to come.


Traveller Information:

  • Famous for: Scenic Beauty, Perfect Location for Experiencing Peace
  • Best Time to Visit: May- November
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs


Things to do:

  • Other Places to visit: Hemis Monastery, Spituk Gomba

07. Mirpal Tso


Lakes abound in Ladakh, and Mirpal Tso is another stunning example. While most of Ladakh's prominent lakes are teeming with visitors, Mirpal Tso is a secluded lake with nothing but isolation and silence for company. The lake is located in Chushul and features both sandy shores and freshwater. It's thrilling, a sight that elicits quiet but culminates in a voyage worth remembering. It is one of the most popular lakes in Ladakh, and it offers a unique perspective that you won't find anywhere else.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Road to Hell because of steep and curved roads. 
  • Best Time to Visit: April- October
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs


Things to do:

  • Other Places to visit: Nubra Valley, Samstanling Gomba

08. Chagar Tso


Chagar Tso is one of the many tiny lakes in Ladakh that add to the beauty of the Ladakhi scenery. It is located on the way to Pangong Tso. This lake is fed by glacier waters and can be watched gently glittering in the sunlight throughout the day. Due to its lack of popularity, there is very little congestion around the lake. A visit to Chagar Tso lake can easily be accomplished along with the journey to Pangong Tso. After a lengthy vehicle ride on your Manali Leh jeep safari, spending some time on its banks will relax and revitalize your body, making the rest of the trip a breeze. 


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Glaciers water, Photographic Location, and Bird-Watching
  • Best Time to Visit: April- October
  • Duration: 1-2 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Camping, Leh Jeep Safari
  • Other Places to visit: Samstanling Gompa, Shanti Stupa.

09. Kyun Tso and Ryul Tso


Kyun Tso and Ryul Tso are twin lakes in Ladakh located near Hanle and Nyoma. These lakes are breathtaking to see. These lakes, nestled among towering cliffs and peaks rising to over 5000 meters, offer some of the most natural experiences in Leh. Their attitude and position also make them difficult to visit, and only the most dedicated adventurers can overcome the route barriers required to reach these twins. The adrenaline you will feel once you arrive is well worth the effort, and you will remember the trip to Kyun Tso and Ryul Tso as one of your best trips in Ladakh for a long time.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Twin Lakes, Beautiful Sunset, and Sunrise
  • Best Time to Visit: May-August
  • Duration: 2-3 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Camping
  • Other Places to visit: Pangong Lake, Tso Kar Lake.

10. Tso Kar


Tso Kar, situated on the Rupshu Plateau in Southern Ladakh, is a magnificent lake known for its size and depth. It's a one-of-a-kind lake, yet it's not well-represented on Ladakh itineraries. The lake has a unique charm that stems from its uniqueness. Tso Kar is a very salty lake with weeds, nettles, and other lake plants growing inside and salt crusts forming on the exterior. Tso Kar's strength is in its tranquillity, even if it is not as big as the Pangong Tso or Tso Moriri.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Twin Lake, Salt-Water Lake.
  • Best Time to Visit: April- September
  • Duration: 2-3 hrs


Things to do:

  • Adventure Activities: Camping, Hiking
  • Other Places to visit: Tso Moriri, Changthang Wildlife Sanctuary.

11. Yaye Tso


On your way from Mahe to Hora La, Kaksang La, and Chushul, you'll pass across Yaye Tso, a heart-shaped, beautiful, and odd-looking volcanic lake. This lake is as intriguing as its name suggests, and it appears as if a volcano is poised to erupt amid the brown mountains. It can be seen from the Hora la pass, and getting there is straightforward, but the beautiful lake has a lot to offer visitors, not only in terms of scenic beauty but also in terms of a feeling that is hard to express in words.


Traveler Information:

  • Famous for: Volcanic Crater, Avian Species
  • Best Time to Visit: May- September
  • Duration: 2-3 hrs


Things to do:

  • Other Places to visit: Kyon Tso 2 Lake, Chalunka Peak.


What makes the lakes in Leh Ladakh unique and curiously pleasing is their simplicity and charm, which can be found nowhere else. These lakes offer an enticing beauty, a vista that takes us beyond our wildest dreams. These Ladakh lakes are an important component of Ladakh tourism, as they play a key role in showering the area with exquisite colors that look brilliant and relaxing to the eyes. These lakes are an essential feature of any journey to Ladakh and should not be missed. So gather your belongings and begin on a journey that will test your resolve while also rewarding your spirit.
